msContents.summary: The Pañcarakṣā corpus ("Five Protections") consists of the Mahāpratisarā, Mahāmāyūrī, Mahāsāhasrapramardanī, Mahāmantrānusāriṇī, and Mahāśītavatī. The earliest evidence for texts grouped together as the "Five Great Dhāraṇīs" comes from Tibetan catalogues around 800 CE, but this compendium is somewhat different from the surviving Sanskrit collection, which is preserved in manuscripts dating back to the eleventh century. These scriptures include spells, enumerations of benefits and ritual instructions for use. With the course of time all of them became deified and five related goddesses emerged. It is, however, important to note that the texts themselves do not have any references to these goddesses. This paper manuscript, dated to 1819 CE, is a quite recent exemplar of the corpus, which testifies to its importance in early modernity as well.

msItem.title: Pañcarakṣā
msItem.incipit: [1v1] evam mayā śrutam ekasmin samaye bhagavān mahāvajramerusikharakūṭāgāre viharati sma || mahā[1v2]vajrasamādhibhūmipratiṣṭhāne mahāvajrakalpavṛkṣasamalaṃkṛte |
msItem.explicit: [178r5] jānīha bhūtāti -1- samāgatāni sthitāni bhūmav athavāntarīkṣe || kurvantu maitrī satataṃ [178r6] prajāsu divā ca rātrau ca carantu dharmam || % || iti tatra buddhānubhāvena devatānubhāvena mahāti iti ryyu [178v1]paśānteti || @ ||
msItem.finalRubric: [178v1] iti mantrānusārīnī parisamāpta|| @ || āryaśrimahāpratiśarā, mahāsāhasrapramardinī, [178v2] mahāmāyurī, mahāśitavatī, mahāmantrānusāranī etāni paṃ-1- mahārakṣāsutrāṇi samāpta || @ @ ||
msItem.colophon: [178v3] ye dharmā hetuprabhāvā hetu teṣān tathāgata hy a-2- teṣāṃ ca yo nirodha evaṃvādī mahāśramaṇaṃ || @ || samvat_ || [178v4] 939 sasatatatatajajajajabhabhabhabha

layout.p: 5-6 lines per page, approximately 40 akṣaras per line.
Double or triple marginal frame lines on some folios. The very beginning of the text is highlighted with red powder.

handDesc.p: Nepālākṣarā in black ink. Possibly several hands, very difficult to distinguish; the following two have been tentatively recognised:

item.marginalia: Running title (prati° for 1-47; sāha° for 48-107; māyu° for 108-169; śīta° for 170-172; mantrā° for 173-178), mid-left margin, verso.

list.item:
On the recto of the first folio, added on the right: $ śrī paṃñca; in the centre: oṃ svasti ātāke-1-remaje oṃ nama śrīganyasānu namaḥ
.
On the inner side of the back cover, an invocation, almost completely faded, and the complete abecedarium, clearly readable, then started over again but not completed.

decoNote.desc: On the outer side of the back cover, traces of materials smeared on the manuscript during worship rites.

history.provenance: Bought by Wright, Daniel Dr. D. Wright on behalf of the Cambridge University Library in 1875.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).
